title: Segura de León
text:
Segura de León is a Spanish <a href="municipalities%20in%20Spain">municipality</a> in the province of <a href="Badajoz%20%28province%29">Badajoz</a>, <a href="Extremadura">Extremadura</a>. It has a population of 2,170 (2007) and an area of 106 km². It belongs to the <a href="Comarcas%20of%20Spain">"comarca"</a> of <a href="Tentud%C3%ADa">Tentudía</a>.
History.
<a href="Ferdinand%20III%20of%20Castile">Ferdinand III</a> tasked the Knights of the <a href="Order%20of%20Santiago">Order of Santiago</a> with reinforcing the land forces of the amphibious <a href="Siege%20of%20Seville">siege on Seville</a>, so the territory around <a href="Montemol%C3%ADn">Montemolín</a> including Segura was conquered by the knights towards 1246–1248 as part of the operations to clean up the rearguard in <a href="Sierra%20Morena">Sierra Morena</a>. <a href="Paio%20Peres%20Correia">Paio Peres Correia</a>, Master of the Order of Santiago, granted Segura a "<a href="fuero">fuero</a>" (copied from that of <a href="Sep%C3%BAlveda%2C%20Segovia">Sepúlveda</a>) on 26 March 1274, thus Segura segregated from the "encomienda" of Montemolín and became a standalone town.
